title: Circular Bowl with Lightly Flaring Lip and Decoration of Blossoming Plum Branches and Birds
creditline: Harvard Art Museums/Arthur M. Sackler Museum, Bequest of Samuel C. Davis
medium: Porcelain with decoration painted in underglaze cobalt blue, with relief plub blossoms touched on in white slip and embellished with pale celadon glaze, the  background with overglaze yellow enamel; with spurious mark underglaze cobalt blue mark reading "Da Ming Xuande nian zhi" within a double circle on the base
